intro: Leleba alba, commonly known as the white leleba, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Leleba alba is valued not only for its ornamental appeal but also for its traditional uses in local medicine.
